Source: Adapted from C. Verlinden, J. Craeybeckx, and E. Scholliers, “Price and Wage Movements in Belgium in the Sixteenth Century” from Economy and Society in Early Modern Europe: Essays from Annales, Routledge & Kegan Paul, London, 1972, p. 74.
content.question: The trends in wages and prices shown in the table were most directly the result of which of the following?

choices.label: The continuing negative effects of the plague and other diseases on urban populations
The development and growth of the money economy
The transfer of New World food crops to Europe
The institution of mercantilist economic polices

content.answer: The development and growth of the money economy
